We‚Äôre excited to host the Bengaluru Healthcare Meetup ‚Äî a curated gathering of health-tech founders, healthcare professionals, investors, and ecosystem enablers coming together to drive meaningful change, 

üéä Key Highlights of Event

This event is designed to spark, connections, conversations & collaboration 

üöÄ Startup Pitch Zone

A major highlight of the event is the Startup Pitch Session, where selected startups will get a chance to:

Pitch their solutions live on stage

Present in front of investors, mentors, enablers and healthcare leaders

Get real-time feedback, visibility, and potential funding or support

If you‚Äôre building something in health-tech, medtech, wellness, or digital healthcare ‚Äî this is your moment to shine.

ü§ù Networking & Connections

The event offers focused time for:

Interacting with fellow founders, investors, and professionals

Exploring partnerships, collaborations, and mentorship

Sharing your journey and learning from others in the ecosystem

Bring your business cards, ideas, and energy ‚Äî this is where real connections begin.


üçΩÔ∏è Dinner & Conversations

We wrap up the evening with a relaxed networking dinner. Enjoy good food, great company, and open conversations in an informal setting. This is your chance to build relationships beyond the pitch many successful partnerships begin at the dinner table.

If you're building or backing the future of healthcare, you need to be in this room. Apply to pitch or register to attend limited seats available. 

Register Here - https://lu.ma/hhj29xhy

üìç Venue - IKP EDEN, Kormanagala, Bengaluru

üìÖ Date - July 12th 2025 (Saturday)

üïí Time - 6.00 PM to 9.00 PM

#IKPEDEN #CEDAT #letsubx #Meetup #BengaluruHealthcareMeetup #StartupPitch #HealthTechInnovation #InvestorConnect #NetworkingDinner #BangaloreStartups #HealthcareFounders

IKP EDEN is hosting an engaging panel discussion and a networking session at the intersection of science, capital, and entrepreneurship.
Guests:
Roopan Aulakh (pi Ventures)
Suraj Nair (Ankur Capital)
Aridni Shah (immunitoAI)
Kshitij Rishi (4baseCare)
Moderator - Amandeep Singh, Ph.D.

Whether you‚Äôre a researcher-turned-founder, an operator ready to start your own venture, or a VC looking to support high-potential startups, this conversation will dive into the realities of launching and scaling in the life sciences.

The expert panel will share practical insights on: 
‚Ä¢ Raising capital in today‚Äôs bio funding climate 
‚Ä¢ Building the right team and scientific vision from day one 
‚Ä¢ Navigating the translational gap between research and product 
‚Ä¢ What investors are really looking for at each stage 
‚Ä¢ Lessons learned from both successful exits and painful pivots

Expect candid stories, actionable takeaways, and an audience of peers equally passionate about transforming science into impact.

Who should attend: Early-stage and aspiring bio founders, venture capitalists, industry executives, and anyone interested in the future of biotech, medtech, and life sciences innovation.

Registration link - https://lnkd.in/gnVy9rZn

üéâ Congratulations to Backyard Creators, an IKP supported-startup, on securing a $600K pre-seed round to advance their pioneering non-invasive bionic ear technology!

Founded by twin brothers Raman Radhakrishnan and Lakshmanan Radhakrishnan, this deep-tech startup is reimagining hearing restoration through magnetic stimulation ‚Äî without surgery. 

A remarkable innovation with the potential to transform lives.

We're especially thrilled to see this become SoundInvest‚Äôs first-ever investment in India ‚Äî a proud moment for Indian deep-tech on the global stage!

Wishing the team continued success as they accelerate R&D and grow their stellar team. Onwards and upwards!

We are proud to be fostering several next gen deep-science based innovative solutions and research that are bridging critical gaps in healthcare, agriculture and environment

Some of these include
üß™Mitigating antimicrobial resistance, strengthening maternal and child health, treating degenerative illnesses and cancer, and developing diagnostics for infectious diseases,
üß™Replacing chemical pesticides with biologicals, boosting crop productivity and farmer incomes, and increasing food security

And, much more!

Presenting you a short film on the C-CAMP ecosystem where young ideas are born, deep science questions are pursued, nurtured and empowered to leapfrog to global leadership

Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD, Priyank M Kharge, Dinesh Gundu Rao, N Cheluvarayaswamy India DST Department of Biotechnology, Atal Innovation Mission Official , Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India NITI Aayog IT BT Department, Karnataka, Abhay Karandikar, Dr. Ekroop Caur, (Vijay) K VijayRaghavan, Startup Karnataka, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade, Startup India, Dr Renu Swarup, Kiran Mazumdar Shaw, Soumya Swaminathan, MeitY Startup Hub, DBT BIRAC, Department of Health and Family Welfare Services - Govt. of Karnataka, K-tech Biotechnology Facilitation Cell Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society, Gates Foundation India, The Rockefeller Foundation, CARB-X, SBI Foundation,  Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), Kamini Walia, National Centre for Biological Sciences, Institute for Stem Cell Science and Regenerative Medicine (BRIC-inStem), Tata Institute for Genetics and Society, India, Novo Nordisk Foundation, Novozymes PATH, Infosys Foundation, Neeraj Jain, Public Health Foundation of India (PHFI), FIND, SELCO Foundation

Successfully wrapped up our Hands-on Training Course in Metabolomics!

18 participants from academia & industry (Unilever, Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Indian Institute of Technology, Madras, Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research (JNCASR), Rayat Bahra University, Jain (Deemed-to-be University), Plaksha University, Pondicherry University, University of Agricultural Sciences, Bangalore, All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Bhubaneswar, Amway India Enterprises Private Limited, Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore, JSS Academy of Higher Education & Research St. Berchmans College, Changanassery) explored in detail the world of small molecules.

From sample preparation to data analysis, we covered it all! Wishing our trainees the very best in using these new skills to make an impact!

Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD Department of Biotechnology Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC)  Department of Science & Technology, Government of India National Centre for Biological Sciences (NCBS) BRIC-Institute for Stem Cell Science and Regenerative Medicine (BRIC-inStem) Tata Institute for Genetics and Society, India Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)

Quick reflections on C-CAMP's 'India AMR Innovation Workshop' under the India AMR Innovation Hub, with guidance from Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India

In the presence of Prof. Ajay Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Govt of India, a strong team of national and international stakeholders from across the ecosystem came together to road map India‚Äôs response to AMR.

We extend our gratitude to all who came together to make this event possible: Dr. Ekroop Caur, Secretary, IT BT Department, Karnataka; Dr. Sujith J Chandy, Executive Director, The International Centre for Antimicrobial Resistance Solutions (ICARS); Dr. Lata Kapoor, Additional Director, National Centre for Disease Control; Kamini Walia, Head, Research Division, Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR); and Prof. L.S. Shashidhara, Director, National Centre for Biological Sciences (NCBS)

Special thanks to all the panellists for sharing their insights on the pressing issues in the fight against AMR.

We also launched the One Health AMR Challenge 2025, in partnership with ICARS, to identify, support, and scale breakthrough technologies addressing AMR across human, animal, and environmental health.

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized a focused workshop titled Financial Projections‚Äô for its incubated startups, led by CA Harshaditya Kabra (Partner, Accorg Consulting).

The session provided early-stage founders with a deep dive into:
üí° Why financial planning is critical from Day 1
 üìà Building dynamic financial models that align with growth
 üìä Cash flow vs. profit‚Äîunderstanding the difference
 üõ°Ô∏è Preparing for investor due diligence
 üß© Unit economics, churn, cost structure, and funding strategies
 üìâ Scenario planning: best, base & worst-case forecasts
 üîê Building transparency and investor-ready documentation

Startups also explored real-time examples, challenges in revenue modeling, and how to build a strong financial foundation for scalable and fundable businesses.

A big thank you to CA Harshaditya and all participants for making the session highly interactive and practical!

We‚Äôve onboarded our first 20 fintech startups from across India as part of the Fintech Centre of Excellence at NSRCEL in partnership with Government of Karnataka. These startups are innovating in savings platforms, vertical fintech applications, payments & transfers, wealthtech & investments, embedded finance, insurtech, and lending & credit and more sectors.

They joined us following a focused 1:1 needs analysis and will now work closely with our team over the next 4‚Äì6 months, where these startups will get support in strengthening their go-to-market and distribution strategies, unlocking growth levers and building a compelling narrative, navigating compliance and infrastructure readiness, and scaling across key areas like fundraising, hiring, and business models.

During the online onboarding, the startups interacted with Prof. Venkatesh Panchapagesan,  Professor of Finance, Faculty Chairperson of IIMB Real Estate Research Initiative, Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIM Bangalore) and the NSRCEL team, setting the tone for the journey ahead.
Looking forward to see the milestones these startups will achieve in their journey ahead!

üí° Are you also building in fintech but missed this round? Here‚Äôs your chance to plug into the ecosystem.

Join our curated FinTech WhatsApp community - a space to engage with other founders, access expert sessions, and tap into opportunities from NSRCEL.

üöÄ Be Where AI Meets Innovation - AI Day for Startups!

AI is reshaping the startup landscape - don‚Äôt miss your chance to lead the change.

 Join us on July 15, 2025 for a power-packed day of AI insights, hands-on learning, and game-changing connections at the Google AI Day for Startups 2025!

Here‚Äôs why you need to be there:

 ‚ö° Stay Ahead: Discover AI Agents, Multimodal AI, and how to unlock real ROI with GenAI‚Äîguided by Google and top industry voices.

 ‚ö° Build the Future: Get hands-on with Gemini API, Vertex AI, Gemma, and AI Studio to bring GenAI to life in your products.

 ‚ö° Network & Thrive: Connect with the right people - founders, VCs, developers - all in one room.

üëâ The next big thing in AI is already here. Will you be part of it?

 üìÖ July 15, 2025 | üìç NSRCEL, IIM Bangalore 

¬†üîó RSVP Now: https://lnkd.in/dUhUwUZQ

Google for Startups Enisha Kalita Farish CV Samhita Rambhatla

#startup #NSRCEL #IIMB #Entrepreneurship #Founders #India #Growth 
#GenAI #AI #GenerativeAI

üöÄ AI Day for Startups is back! üöÄ

We are excited to invite you to the Google AI Day for Startups event, happening on July 15, 2025, at NSRCEL, IIM Bangalore. This year‚Äôs event is packed with new insights and hands-on learning designed specifically for early-stage startups looking to integrate Generative AI into their products.

The event is part of a nationwide series hosted by Google and ecosystem partners to empower startups across India.

What‚Äôs new this year?

We‚Äôll be exploring cutting-edge AI technologies like AI Agents, Multimodal AI, and the AI Commercialization process - including insights into ROI and real-world applications.

Here‚Äôs what you can expect:¬†
üîπ AI Insights: Gain knowledge on 2025 GenAI trends, latest model developments, and AI tools like AI Agents, Multimodal AI, and AI commercialization strategies, with contributions from Google, industry leaders, VCs, and founders.
üîπ Hands-on Workshops: Participate in guided codelabs where you‚Äôll build GenAI applications and features using powerful Google tools like Gemini API, Gemma, Vertex AI, and AI Studio.

If you're a startup founder, CXO, or developer eager to level up your AI knowledge and skills, this is an event you won‚Äôt want to miss!

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) |

Thrilled to see Sound Hub Denmark backing trailblazing #soundtech and #deeptech innovations like Backyard Creators through their latest investment!

As a startup supported by DERBI Foundation, it's inspiring to witness global initiatives like this that are investing in purpose-driven ventures with transformative potential. 

At DERBI Foundation, we‚Äôve experienced firsthand how the right ecosystem support‚Äîaccess to prototyping, mentorship, and patient capital‚Äîcan shape the journey of early-stage innovators.

Opportunities like these validate the importance of cross-border collaboration in building technologies that don't just push the envelope but also address real-world challenges in health, sustainability, and quality of life.

Kudos to Sound Hub Denmark for amplifying the sound of the future‚Äîquite literally! üîä

üéì Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! üß†üöÄ

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation‚Äôs lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow‚Äôs challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! üå±üí°

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Work In Progress ‚Äì July 2025 edition is here! 

This month, we spotlight innovation that shows up in many forms‚Äîquiet pilots, policy dialogues, and global collaborations. 

From linking biogas systems to global carbon markets to grassroots workshops on soil resilience, to deep-tech solutions making their mark across Southeast Asia, Europe, and the Middle East‚Äîthis edition captures the steady convergence of ideas, communities, and systems. 

You‚Äôll find start-ups shaping climate-resilient agriculture, ocean sustainability, dignified health access, and decentralised energy. You'll also see how IP milestones, field demos, and cross-sector partnerships are laying the foundation for future scale. 

Explore these stories of layered progress‚Äîand the people making it possible. 

Subscribe to receive future editions: https://lnkd.in/gw6bPWVh
¬† ¬†
Explore past editions: https://lnkd.in/gh4aF9cq¬† 

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Smita Rakesh | Dr Kavita Singh | Neeraj Jain | Harish Hande 

#WorkInProgress #InvestedInImpact #InnovationForImpact

Innovators working on developing medical devices for screening and diagnosis often struggle with accessing funds for clinical trials and regulatory pathways. At this stage equity funding is almost non-existent.  (Sometimes it may be there but comes with extremely bad terms combined wifh hyper-dilution and horrific captables). 

This is where blended finance needs to be redefined. Capital providers need to understand that  de-risking early stage startups requires a continuum of capital where non dilutive and dilutive capital pools operate synchronously throughtout the product lifecycle depending upon the stage, complexity and market readiness of the innovations. This is not like a relay race where capital providers change roles but more like an orchestra where different pools can synchronise their risk underwriting and maximise the impact while creating value as the innovations transition from the lab to market.

#blendedfinance #valleyofdeath #impact #innovation  Social Alpha

What a day at Venture Center (Official Account), Pune! After an insightful morning, our Day 1 unfolded beautifully with a special Founder's Meetup on the rooftop ‚Äì complete with refreshing rain and delicious vada pav!

It was truly inspiring to connect with these incredible entrepreneurs and hear their stories:

Kedar Kulkarni: Ex-Deshpande Startups, Kedar is now a proud ambassador of our mission. His entrepreneurial journey began with us, and he continues to drive impact at Wadhwani Foundation. A true member of our family!

Tejas Limkar : Tejas, founder of GreenMinds Agro & incubated in our NIDHI EIR program, is revolutionizing agriculture with bee venom. His passion for sustainable beekeeping is truly inspiring!

Javed Inamdar: Javed, CEO of Pravi and part of our Incubation Cohort 24, is a fierce advocate for Deshpande Startups. His openness to feedback and seasoned professionalism make him stand out!

Aboli Shirguppe-Mirje: Inspired by Javed's experience with us, Aboli, Pravi's new co-founder, is set to join our next incubation cohort! Her excitement is a testament to the power of our community and programs.

Jasveer Singh: Jasveer, founder of Sense it Out - SICCA, is a passionate entrepreneur. His journey through our NIDHI Accelerator programs and programs like Innovate for Digital India showcases his dedication to sustainable agri-tech!

These interactions truly highlight the vibrant and collaborative spirit of the Pune startup ecosystem. So much learning and inspiration in one day!


Manish Jaiswal | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar

#PuneStartups #FoundersMeetup #StartupEcosystem #VentureCentre #Entrepreneurship #DeshpandeStartups

Day 1 in Pune: Exploring Synergies at Venture Center (Official Account)!

What an insightful start to our #Pune ecosystem deep-dive! The Deshpande Startups team had a fantastic Day 1 at Venture Center (Official Account), hosted by CSIR- National Chemical Laboratory.

Huge thanks to Shruti Devasthali (Head - Funding and Investment), Sujaya Ingale (Head - Scientific Initiatives), Soma Chattopadhyay (Head - Incubation and mentoring), and Neha Jacob (Head-Operations), for your valuable time and for giving us a comprehensive tour. 

We were incredibly impressed by:
‚Ä¢ Their sharp focus on science and research-based startups.
‚Ä¢ A robust innovation ecosystem with a strong network of scientists.
‚Ä¢ High-end lab facilities (Class 7 & 8 clean rooms, cryo-preservation) perfect for deep R&D.
‚Ä¢ A brilliant model allowing startups massive discounts on lab access by charging industry players standard rates‚Äîeven major companies use their labs for quick R&D!
‚Ä¢ Their innovative co-founder model, where they contribute research and take equity.

Looking forward to two more days of exploring Pune's vibrant startup scene!

Manish Jaiswal | Satya Prakash Dash | Premnath Venugopalan | Viswanath V. | Protoshop Tinkering Lab | Vaishnavi Pote | Kounsar Sheikh | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities.

ExSURE PVT. LTD.  BioMarkIQ FastSense Innovations Serigen Mediproducts (Official account) Anatomech  Adiuvo Diagnostics Pvt. Ltd.  TeraLumen Solutions Pragmatech Healthcare Solutions Pvt. Ltd. Kozhnosys Madhur Motwani MBBS PhD Sayantani Pramanik Palit, Ph.D. Jilma Peruvangat Preeti Nigam Joshi Premnath Venugopalan Neha Jacob Manish Gore, Ph.D. Namita Joshi

A warm welcome to ExSURE PVT. LTD.!

ExSure is advancing cancer treatment with exosome-based drug delivery that targets both tumors and cancer stem cells, aiming to reduce chemotherapy‚Äôs side effects and lower relapse rates. Their growing portfolio of reagents and lab services is enabling researchers in cancer, exosomes, and cell biology to take forward their work with confidence.

At the helm are Dr. Swastika Paul, a cancer stem cell biologist and entrepreneur passionate about translating research into real-world therapies, and Abhishek Dutta, a researcher dedicated to developing targeted treatments against cancer stem cells.

We are excited to have ExSure join our community as they work toward making targeted cancer therapies more effective and accessible.

We are delighted to share that our Bio-NEST facility at VentureStudio, Ahmedabad University, recently supported a PhD student in her research. With access to our wet lab, state-of-the-art equipment, and expert guidance, she successfully navigated a critical phase of her research journey.

Kudos to her achievements, and here‚Äôs to nurturing many more breakthrough ideas!

Researchers and students pursuing their dissertation or thesis project often face critical challenges due to lack of adequate¬†instrumentation and technical guidance, leading to significant delays.

In the past two years, we have supported more than 15 research scholars and students pursuing their Master's and PhD programmes, with our advanced instrumentation facility for microbiology, molecular biology, chromatography and cell culture, backed with our technical support.

At Bio-NEST, we remain committed to empowering students, researchers, and startups working on impactful biotechnology and life sciences innovations.

To know more, write to us at¬†bionest@ahduni.edu.in

#VentureStudio #BioNEST #AhmedabadUniversity #PhDResearch #BiotechInnovation #Startups #BIRAC #StudentSuccess #LifeSciences

In hardware development, there is no room for approximation. Scaling isn‚Äôt just about big ideas ‚Äî it‚Äôs about precision, consistency, and systems that deliver every single time.
At ProtoQuik Launchpad, startups learn how to engineer for scale. Thus, creating systems that don‚Äôt just work once, but work reliably every time. Because in Deep Tech, precision is not optional; it‚Äôs essential.
